summary: This document consists of four daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, NY, for Monday, August 12, 2019. The logs detail routine operational activities, inmate counts, equipment checks, and inmate movements throughout three shifts (Morning, Day, and Evening Watch). It notes two inmates on psychological observation with companions and records the arrival of new commits, including one brought in by the FBI late in the evening.

events.title: Routine Correctional Center Operations
events.description: Standard daily operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including multiple inmate counts, equipment checks, body alarm tests, and inmate movements.

events.title: Inmate Hospital Transport
events.description: Inmate #86123-054 was transported to the local hospital with BOP staff and later returned to the facility.

events.title: New Inmate Commitments
events.description: Three new inmates (Garcia, Paulino, Perez) were committed during the Evening Watch shift, and later, the FBI brought in one additional new commit.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The logs document routine operations at the MCC New York on August 12, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Two inmates (#71230-054 and #85428-054) are noted as being on psychological observation with inmate companions across all three shifts.
The FBI brought in one new commit to the facility late in the evening (at 11:05 PM during the Evening Watch).
The logs show no WITSEC (Witness Security) inquiries were received during any of the three shifts documented.
The document is marked CONFIDENTIAL and is part of the SDNY records related to the Epstein case.
